alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 11:09PM EST until January 10 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Delaware... Red Clay Creek At Wooddale affecting New Castle County. For the Red Clay Creek...including Wooddale...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red Clay Creek at Wooddale. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Flooding begins in adjacent open fields. At 7.5 feet, Barley Mill Road begins to flood. Brandywine Springs Park floods. At 8.5 feet, Flooding begins near Old Capital Trail and Newport Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 PM EST Tuesday was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 3.3 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.6 feet on 07/05/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (11 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Red Clay Creek Wooddale 7.0 8.5 Tue 10 p 3.2 MSG 8.6 12am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 800 AM EST.
